children.text: The sarking under the roof tiles of this home has not had an anti-ponding board installed beneath it to stop it from sagging down behind the fascia, stopping the water that collects on it from properly draining into the gutters.
Part 3.5.1.2 Roof Tiling of the Building Code of Australia (BCA), requires that
‘Where sarking is installed, an anti-ponding device/board must be provided on roofs with pitches less than 200; and on all roof pitches where there are no eaves overhang’ .
Australian Standard AS 2050 Installation of Roof Tiles, Section 3 Installation, clause 3.1.1 General, states
‘Where required, pliable and reflective-foil sarking shall be installed in accordance with AS 4200.2’
and clause 3.1.2 Anti-ponding Device/Boards, also states that
‘An anti-ponding device/board shall be provided as follows;
(a) On sarked roofs with pitches of 20o or less;
(b) On all roof pitches where there are no eaves overhang’ .
Australian Standard AS 4200.2 Pliable Building Membranes and Underlays, Part 2: Installation Requirements, clause 6.2 Treatment of Eaves, states that
‘The pliable building membrane shall be installed in a manner which will ensure it can drain into eaves gutters any water which it collects, and that no ponding occurs’ .
The present sarking must have the required anti-ponding board installed under it for the roof of this home to comply with the requirements of the NCC’s BCA and Australian Standards.
